About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

I am a 3rd year CS undergraduate at Michigan Tech! My passion lies in programming and web development, I like to work with SQL databases but above all I enjoy learning new skills and picking up/working on projects.

License Recognition Software

Head Developer

At the 2019 Michigan Tech Winter Wonderhack I competed as leader of a two man team and placed 3rd overall and won 'Most Practical' award. The project I headed was software which was written in Python and used machine learning to identify license plates and parse them in order to read letters and numbers from a jpg file. More info on this can be found on my 'My Work' page.

Barkboard

Database Developer

NCSA is a student organization, which I am a part of, at Michigan Tech which strives to further develop networking, computing, and cybersecurity skills outside the classroom through independent research and weekly seminars. We have recently taken on a project to revitalize Michigan Tech's now discontinued Barkboard. We are rebuiliding the site from the ground up and I have taken lead of developing the database system which will back the site.

CS3425

Introduction to Database Systems

The final project for this class was to design and implement an SQL backed online exam system. My responsibilities for the project included constructing an E-R diagram representing the conceptual design of the database as well as creating a refined relational schema from said E-R diagram. I was also in charge of implementing the system and wrote the code for it in PHP and used HTML and CSS for the web end.
